First time coming here and we fell in love with this place,their Bison wrap is the best,this is our new favorite for healthy food!!!

YUMMMY! I got the bison cheese steak wrap and my friend had the California chicken wrap , we split them both ! Quick and fast after the gym. Food was fresh as well. The bison was a little salty but it could of been the chef hehhe !

This is just on the basis of the madness of how they made an $8 smoothie: they added a heap of ice, which, you know is basically just filler. Then they ended up making too much, filled my cup and dumped the extra --- all of those wonderful fruits and vegetables --- down the sink. So frustrating to pay nearly ten bucks for some diluted smoothie, the rest of which is wasted, flowing down the drain.

THis has been on my list for a while but rarely do I get to this side of town. I liked it! I'll be back, let's break it down

Atmosphere: Clean, well lighted,,, I felt healthy walking in. Smells fresh.  Basic seating set up.  I went at 11:30 Saturday and it was not too crowded,, people there but not too much.

Food: That's what you're here for right? The best description again is,,, clean.  Seems to me that it's all natural organic type food.  I've had burgers, Avocado/Crab cups, and some of the drinks.  Burgers are surprisingly juicy, and I'm looking to try some of the salads next time.

Drink: Note the smoothies are like a meal so you probably don't want that AND a full meal unless you are splitting.   The juices are all very nice and clean.  Favourite is the Wellness drink.

Price: For what it is,,  a little expensive,, a juice and any meal will be twenty.  One of the other Yelpers claimed it was the Whole Foods of restaurants and I think its a great comparison.

Miscellaneous: One of the few places I can think of that put calorie counts.
I eat here at aminimum once per week. The food is good and healthy.  I will continue to eat here

I stopped at the one on Flamingo for the first time yesterday and took forever to decide what I wanted.  I asked the gal at the counter for suggestions and one of hers was the summer salad.  I ordered a small one with chicken and it was absolutely delicious and very large portion.  I will definitely come back.
Definitely a fan and will be making this a daily occurrence while in town.  Tried the Green Smoothie & Straight to the Heart both are great!
Great place to get an after workout juice or smoothie!  You all are fabulous!

This is my new favorite spot in Las Vegas for a healthy quick bite! I heard about this place from a friend and I have been addicted ever since. 

What I order:
- Turckey Burger plain wrapped in a Lettuce shell. It is amazing, low cal and low carb.
- Tofu fries. They taste like cheese sticks! SOO good. I dont care for the Jicama fries, skip those unless you are on an ultra healthy kick. 
- Cup for water. This is a MUST. They have free cucmber infused water, it tastes wonderful. 
- Juice. The ginger limeade is my favorite! It is under 200 calories and packed with healthy fruits and veggies! i neer imagined I would crave a green juice, but it tastes sooo good! It is the perfect consistancy to drink and stays cold long enough to enjoy it. 

Best part: This place is packed with healthy people all the time! So if you are like me and need some insiping to get your soft butt to the gym, check this place out to eat! There are lots of HOT guys (and girls) to check out. They also have wifi so I can yelp. 

Make sure you check in to get a dollar off a juice/smoothie :)

Only downfall, it is slightly pricy. If you are on a Jr. Bacon Cheese diet, this isnt your place. But remember, spinach, tofu and fruits arent cheap to buy.

I have to agree with some of the other posters about the bland food.  Decided to check this place out for the first time with a friend and unfortunately, can't see myself returning.  I ordered a rough cut roma tomato salad and the tortilla soup.  My friend ordered what looked like a mix of steamed veggies and rice (steamed broccoli, kale, mixed squash/zucchini).   The salad they brought out for me was mainly radicchio and frisee (the red/purple lettuce and the light green "fuzzy" lettuce just in case you're not sure what that is); two of the most bitter greens that I'm least fond of.  The dressing was a bitter vinaigrette with lemon, I believe.  The tomato slices appeared to have been sitting out for a while; not fresh at all.  There were some spinach leaves thrown in along with some cucumber.  I took a bite and was hit with bland bitterness.  At first, I thought there just wasn't dressing but the guy explained that there was dressing on it.  The tortilla soup came out and did not look like soup - it appeared very thick, almost like orange hummus.  I dipped in and it tasted very sweet, like pumpkin, without any type of "mexican/tortilla" flavor.  I couldn't force myself to eat it although I was starving.  I told my friend she should try the soup to see if it was just me.  She seemed very hesitant by the look of it.  She took a dip and stated, "There is no flavor....it's just...sweet?"  I didn't quite understand what I had ordered.  Her meal came out; just steamed veggies and brown rice.  I tried some and it was fine but I can't fathom paying the $13 for this when it is one of the easiest things to make at home....steamed veggies and rice.  I lost out on $12 myself.  I couldn't eat my food and soon pushed it to the side so I could just focus on hang time and not the hunger pangs in my stomach.  When I left, I came home and made an amazing organic salad, topped with LOTS of avocado.  They should hire me to improve their salad menu. :)

I had the low carb salad with chicken.  The serving of the small chicken was 6oz which was great.  The dressing tasted fantastic, but there wasn't much of salad in a half order.  The cashier made me think it would have been bigger.  I ended up taking a slice of my bf's buffalo chicken pizza. OMG it was really good - and i'm not saying that just because i'm carb depleted.  The toppings were very good and had a nice sweet tangy zip.  My kids enjoyed cheese pizza and pasta, but i was confused that the kids size pizza was the same size as my boyfriends full size pizza.  I don't get that.  In the end, i really enjoyed dining here.  It would be great to see one of these restaurants open in the N. Phoenix, AZ area where I live!

Newer restaurant to the area, I had to try since their motto is "Healthy". 
I had the skinny chef salad with Ranch dressing - good salad for lunch. I got the small portion, I can only imagine how large the large portion is, so really impressed with the sizes. I'll definitely be going back to try more of the food and the juices. 
I do like the fact that instead of sugar, the sweetener choice for the juices is Agave Nectar. Not quite paleo, but a better option than sugar. 
My only comment is I wish they had a grass-fed burger and organic veggie options.

G&P thank you for being so good to me! Everything on the menu is delicious. 
My favorites according to season:

Summer Breakfast:
Acai Berry Bowl
Chocolate Veggechino

Winter Breakfast:
Real Deal Oatmeal 
Greek Scramble ***
Whey pancakes with bananas and agave syrup YUM!! ***

Favorites ANYTIME! :
Green Ginger Lime 
Wellness Drink
Tofu Fries
Tofu and Soy Chorizo spinach wrap ***
Vanilla coconut power balls

I came here for a lunch meeting with one of the offices that we work a lot with and at first I was very hesitant as I have never heard of this place. What a great choice to go to for the health conscious eater.  I ordered the peanut chicken skewers and the G&P salad. The portions are big, enough for two people.   The staff were really friendly.  Prices very reasonable.  Although it's a bit far from work, I will definitely visit this place again.

Had the summer berry salad with chicken and it was delicious! My only complaint is that the large salad was not that large and $16 so it is a bit pricey but everything on the menu looked so good, I can't wait to try more!
Want a healthy lunch but not a boring one? This place is it! And their sweet potato fries are great!

Great place to load up on protein or eat clean. It is pricey for the portion you get but their offerings are one of a kind! They offer bison, ostrich, your traditional chicken, and tofu. This is my second time at g&p but my first at this location. Its super hip and it's also a great place for your lunch break or catch up on work. 

I ordered their bison cheese steak on a spinach wrap which is about 600+ calories for $10.99. It also comes with their yummy tofu fries and dipping sauce! The cheese steak is delish and the bison is super lean. Bison is just naturally full in flavor so if you're looking for a good manly meat that's lean but tastes like cow (mmoooo) go bison! I also ordered their white chocolate veggiechino which is 500+ calories for $6.99. I chose the almond milk (you can choose the option of soy or Almond milk) it was pretty delish with grains of grinded up coffee bean. If you're looking for a big caffeine kick I would not bet that the veggiechino will be a good pick me up especially if you're a coffee drinker. But as a sweet milky treat. I think it's a good choice. 

My meal summed up to $20 for myself. It is a bit pricey but if it's just one of those clean eating going out to lunch days I say go for it but I would only drop in occasionally if I'm in the mood. I just think their price does equal the value in portion for me.

Super good. Feel good food.

I ordered the BBQ Chicken Pizza. I was so hungry I couldn't snap a pic in time. In fact, I had to eat the pizza before my guest could even sit down to start eating his pizza. 

The place is legit, the workers are friendly, and the food is fresh. A+ five stars from me.

I am somewhat of a fitness enthusiast so I was looking for a place that sold healthy food and drinks. I came across Greens and Proteins while driving along eastern avenue. Now I'm used to cooking and making my own healthy greens and protein foods, so I have a bit higher standard for places like this. First of all, they are relatively expensive but this is understandable considering the healthy ingredients which tend to be natural or organic. 

My friend ordered one of the actual meals while I ordered one of the green drinks, I believe it was the one with chocolate flavor. Anyways, my drink tasted horrible. Maybe it was too healthy but I couldn't swallow it. If you are into this type of thing, maybe its for you. My friend ordered something I believe with the eggs and it was ok.

The environment is very nice. When we went the place was booming so I have no complaints there. The staff is friendly and it gives off a healthy, clean, fitness vibe. I think you just have to be into this type of food. It's a different taste which I don't like but many health buffs will like. Maybe I will try a different food so I shouldn't jump to conclusions. I will update this review once I try something different and will take pictures of what I ordered.
Best juices in town! I I am addicted to the wellness and antioxidant juice. Nice clean location as well.... Oh yeah can't forget about the turkey burgers!

The steak salad was awesome and surprisingly filling. The V9 juice was disappointingly bland-so bad, that I had to add some Tabasco to add some favor and even then it was sad. Fresh juice is supposed to be flavorful and vibrant. I had high hopes for this place

Every time I come here I get great service & pay great prices. They always give me suggestions due to my cravings & they always hit it spot on! The place is always packed with people... they are definitely doing something right. I will continue to come back and be a loyal Greens & Proteins customer.

Food here is good the buffalo chicken pizza and the bison philly are my two favorites. I really don't need to explain why this place is soooo good just go and try for your self you won't be disappointed. But seriously the bison Philly was almost if not just as good as a Philadelphia Philly
Consistent and delicious!  try the wellness drink! I can eat here everyday. The barbecue chicken pizza is my favorite.

If you are looking for a place with fresh eats and yummy shakes, this is it.  I really liked it, it seems unique and has really great "healthy" food.  Located near LVAC, it attracts that healthier, fit crowd; but I went for the shakes.  I do try to watch what I eat, and this place does not offer greasy and heavy food.  It's fresh and well proportioned.  Friendly, inshape (lol) staff and patrons as well.

On a recent visit to the strip we decided to travel off the strip about 10 minutes west.  Very good selection of foods and drinks; the salad was large and the chicken was juicy.  I also tried the "green drink" and this is a good meal replacement complete with fruits and vegetables.  We liked it so much that we went back for breakfast and the multi grain cakes were good but the french toast w/ agavi syrup was excellent and both for $15.00  Lastly don't forget the "free" cucumber water.  Can't wait for locations in So Cal.
So delicious! I drove past this place a few times after the gym, and finally stopped in today. I had the G&P veggie burger with jicama fries and wow! I scarffed it down quick. Yum :))
I wish I had discovered this place sooner! I love that it is truly healthy food AND it's delicious.

Very good. Wellness drink is refreshing and French toast is hearty, sweet, and delicious. Big portion. Definitely not "fast food" meaning your gonna wait 10 minutes for food. Could use another location in Highlands Ranch!

Greens & Proteins is amazing, hands down. It's the only place I go when I'm looking for a bite to eat and want to eat healthy. So many places have tried the health conscious menu and the end result is flavorless food (Lyfe Kitchen) but everything I've had here is delicious. The bison wrap w/ tofu fries is my favorite. Highly recommended.

This is the best place to go after a workout. Not a good place to go if you are super hungry. You won't feel guilty after your workout since they serve sort of healthy entrees. The serving here is smaller than usual and is pricey. 

My bf and I ordered a bison burger (very dry even though my bf mentioned that he wanted it cooked medium), crab wrap and a BBQ chicken pizza. For 3 items, it was almost $40. The crab wrap was not bad. You can see some crab pieces in it. The pizza was okay. Nothing special. 

One thing I liked here is their free cucumber lemon water. Very refreshing! 

Not sure if we will be back.

Got the green leaf berry smoothie. It was horrible. Didn't say anything until a worker asked how it was. I bluntly said, "This tastes like sh*t." Which it did because the worker said it doesn't even look the right color. He then asked if he could make it right. I asked if he could make me a peanut butter banana instead. He came back with a better tasting concoction. Way to do service recovery. Thumbs up to Kevin (the worker who saved the night.)

Update: All I drank after the gym was the shakes. I ended up tasting them again...Something in those drinks just didn't agree with me. My girlfriend has the chorizo wrap and didn't have any issues. She enjoyed it and didn't get sick.

Tried this place after a Pilates class down the street. I love it! I wish It was closer to where I live. I legit copied the tofu and jicama fries at home. They were soooo good and truly an awesome alternative to reg fries. Yummy cucumber water too....and its free!!!

I was not impressed with my juice at all. When I order juice I expected it to be juice. I received my drink and as I was drinking it I noticed something was weird. I asked the guy at the counter what type of juicer they used because I've never had such a Texture before... He informed me that they do not use juicers at all but they blend their juices... Then that is not considered a juice! That is a blended vegetable drink. If I wasn't with my coworkers I would have asked for a full refund because I was not even able to drink it. I am on a strict juice diet and cannot have much fiber and that was definitely not in the description. Plus you would think being a healthy alternative restaurant they would know that blending vegetables ruins the nutrient value. 

You would think when somebody advertises juices that it would be juice not blended and chunky ( gross) 

Waste of my time and money! Ended up skipping lunch that day because I couldn't finish the "juice" without gagging and didn't have time to go anywhere else. 

I am giving it a two star because inside was clean, nice, and customer service was great! Everybody who got food there said it was a bit overpriced, which I agree.  

That was definitely the worst juice I have ever had in my life. That was my first time there and definitely will not come back.

I admit I've probably driven past this place a billion times but finally paid attention to it when I was on Groupon and saw they had a $12 for $6 deal and had to try it. Came in during lunch time and it wasn't too busy. I was told I had to make sure I spent at least $12 for the Groupon deal so I went ahead and ordered an Acai Smoothie which wasn't amazing compared to other Acai smoothies I've ordered but still drink worthy. For a meal I ordered the Turkey Burger with Jicama Fries as I've never had Jicama before and well, the turkey burger was excellent but Jicama, I am NOT a fan of you and should have gone with the Tofu instead. There was a little bit of a wait especially in between my smoothie and meal, like I literally was almost done with my smoothie by the time my food was ready but all staff members had a smile on their face, very friendly and even with some slow service I still got in and out of there in a decent amount of time during the lunch hour. I'll definitely be back to try more especially as they serve healthy menu items for a fair price compared to others!
My favorite go to place for a quick healthy meal! Definitely the best protein pancakes in town! Staff is extremely friendly and always great service! Thanks guys!!

I get food here often.  Today they decided to not put my tofu fries in the order.  I don't see how hard it is to ensure the customer get what they pay for.  I guess if I decide to return I will just have to treat them like incompetent fast food workers and checks entire order.  This sucks because I really like their food.

Clean, bright, and nice. I will return to enjoy the healthy variety. You can chose from many of the menu protein drinks or create your own. This restaurant is a great place to eat that won't give you indigestion or undermine good health.

Really enjoyed the food....This was my first time eating bison and I must say it was yummy...I'm now in search of a eatery in my area that serves bison. Everything was delicious and healthy which is extremely important to me as a physique competitor. I will check this place out again when I return to Vegas for a visit,

I really wanted to like this place.  I love to eat healthy food.  The Green Ginger Limeade was very good - no complaints about the taste, just the price.  $5.99 for a drink is too much for me.  Then I ordered the Turkey Burger wrapped in lettuce.  The presentation was nice, but it tasted terrible.  The meat was either under cooked or just had a nasty gamey taste. I tried to cover up the flavor of the meat with ketsup and mustard.  My total bill was $17.27.  Too expensive to eat food that tastes bad.

Just went to greens and proteins because it was recommended by my neighbor. First of all the place is spotless and the staff is friendly. I was skeptical because healthy food tends to be poor in taste but this is not the case at G&P. The chocolate and peanut butter shake was excellent and I had no clue there were vegetables mixed in. Then the meal came out and wow the whole wheat French toast was scrumptious ! This place has completely changed my mind about health food tasting like cardboard that's for sure. The owner himself even came out to greet me and ask how my meal was. I give five stars for the original recipe, the cleanliness of the establishment and the fact that the owner has direct involvement in the operation. This is always indicates that someone takes pride in what they do and wants the best quality products/services for their customers. I'll be back soon.

Really love their options and portion sizes. The salads are very delicious and the bison burger is LOADED with protein! The taste is very delicious and I've yet to try their drinks. Btw they have alternatives to Coke and Pepsi for fountain drinks and they're really good too. It's too bad they don't have one by my house in long beach.
Food is always fresh and tasty.  Service is good.  Place is clean.  I love this place.  Lots of healthy choices.

After the gym I am starving and in need of some refreshments. Greens and Proteins has a great menu for the healthy bunch of us out there looking for clean food. I leave full but not heavy, and def recommend the bison burger...it was fantastic!

You'll get fresh healthy food, but expect to pay a price for it.

Stopped in for a quick healthy lunch, was greeted with friendly service and paid $35 for two to eat.  The green leaf berry smoothie was good, but the apple pie smoothie tasted watered down.  Next the Margherita Pizza (about 10" across / enough for 2 people to eat) was just like any other you can get and the Thai Chicken Peanut Satays sounded appealing.  They were supposed to be spicy, but were not at all; they were chicken skewers with some kind of creamy peanut sauce over them.  

Nice atmosphere - guilt free eating - just wish it was more affordable.
Great food the chicken wrap is great. They even have a small Vegan menu with pizza and nachos. Overall great place for a healthy living.
best smoothie I have ever had, chocolate peanut butterr.... I died.

I love the fast casual/quality food/healthy food concept. The execution can be a bit spotty and the food, while decent, won't make you forget about all the unhealthy (and more delicious) alternatives around town. The BBQ pizza was ok, but the crust was too soft and doughey. The bison cheesesteak wrap was good but I couldn't help but fantasize about biting into a real Philly cheesesteak while eating it. The girl behind the counter raved about the tofu fries but I wasn't a fan. I've never been much of a tofu fan and the fries failed to convert me.

My favorite part of their menu is the "Build your own custom meal" where you pick a protein, grain, green, and sauce of your choosing. It's perfect for when you want a quick meal, don't feel like cooking, and aren't in the mood for traditional fast food. The pork tenderloin with the balsamic reduction was good, but the portabello mushroom was overcooked. Portion sizes are on the small side so don't expect to walk away full. 

There may be some drawbacks to this place, but it's still a good option for a quick meal.

Great place for green smoothies, juices and healthy food. Some of my favorites are salmon and bison burger. I wanna build up the courage to do get the ostrich burger. :-) for another time. Prices are also very reasonable here. Modern look and feel of th place. Will absolutely become a regular here. 

Yum yum

I had the green shake and the turkey club wrap and both were very good! Everything was so fresh. I'm currently 8 months pregnant and this is a perfect spot for healthy eating. I'll definitely be back!

I've been here numerous times.  For a occasional bite to eat I have no problems.  I was eating some of the build your owns. I decided to see how many calories it actually was......   You give a cup of brown rice.  Your menu states that it is 159 calories. It should be about 200.  Read a box of brown rice.  Chicken breast I weighed it at 5-6 oz cooked. Which is 6-8 raw.  That should be about 340 calories. 40-50 calories uncooked per ounce not 272.

Love this place! Been looking for a new spot to eat healthy at and I found it. Ir had the create your own with chicken, brown rice, broccoli ad get the lemon vinaigrette dressing and put it all over everything. Love that dressing, seriously wish they would bottle it and let me take it home! I've also had the veggie pizza and chef salad here too which are both really good and light. All in all this place is phenomenal and all the staff are really nice!

Quick and healthy! My kind of place.
So far I liked everything I've ordered.
Favorite thing on the menu- Bison on spinach wrap.
Super healthy, super yummy!

Easy order, easy pick up on the way to work or football practice.

Had to stop into a place that holds two of my most prominent diet words in it's name. I really wish I had more time to try more of the menu, but, very limited amount of time in Vegas.

That said, the breakfast that was served to the table next to me looked amazing and I can't wait to try it.

This go around though, hammered down on the "build my own" with ostrich (check another animal off my "got ya bitch" list of animals consumed!), sketti squash and some mashed sweet taters. Also got an antioxidant blast smoothie (berry mix).

So, the chow.
Ostrich - very lean, and decent. Tried it without the citrus bbq sauce first, and it was ok. Was hoping for a bit of seasoning or something, but, it was just cooked meat and no seasoning help. With the citrus bbq, not bad at all and solid chunk of meat. Texture was and cooked temp were not bad either. All in all, a solid slab of lean meat.

Sketti squash - tasteless and didn't seem to be cooked enough. Was very disappointed in this one. I'm usually a huge fan of this and make it my own quite a bit (gives me something to do when my madre delivers 12 giant squashes from her garden). But, a little citrus bbq made it tolerable to wolf down like a desert coyote.

Mashed sweet taters - very good. Was really happy to see this on the menu as a carb option. I hadn't had them in a while, and was pleasantly surprised to have a solid plate of mashed sweets. Perfectly fluffy, not stringy (which sweet taters can be when mashed thanks to the fibers), and solid flavor. Only thing missing was a chance to throw some cinnamon on them. If you've  never done that before, give it a go. Fantastic. I promise.

Antioxidant smoothie - Great flavor, miss on the texture. I knew it'd be a bit think and chunky thanks to the apples (without an amazing juicer, apples are a prick to deal with). But, was hoping this place would have a juicer that'd take that away. Not so. 

In any event, smoothie and food rang up over $24. Considering the ingredients and if I were to order something similar elsewhere, I'm sure it'd be close to that too. So, not overly fussy with the price.

I love this kind of place. Everything is kept clean and the drinks are always prepared fresh. It's easy to eat healthy here. They have great selection for any craving you have. I love the complimentary cucumber citrus water. They lose a star because of their pricing.

Awesome pick up service of excellent food. We called in our order and when we showed up the ladies labeled each meal with the name of the person who ordered it. Our customers really loved that. Delivered by www.postmates.com. We deliver from the restaurants you want to your home or office.

I've eaten here a couple time's great fresh tasting food and very healthy.
the Low Carb Caesar Salad With Grilled Chicken Breast is the best salad i've ever had.

Second visit here was night and day from my 1st. I think his name was Stefano and I didn't catch the name of the supervisor that night. They were extremely nice. I used my check in Coupon with no backlash this time from the staff. Food was amazing Bison wrap!! Love it!! I'll be back again. I'm happy I have this place a second chance   

Ps 
I forgot to get my fork and knife and the supervisor got it for me. Very nice of her !!

Paid my first visit to Greens and Proteins for a healthy bite to eat after a not so healthy day of eating. I ordered an order of the chicken satay and had managed to snag a few bites of my man's teriyaki chicken wrap. I wanted to try their smoothies or juices, but I convinced myself to settle with their complimentary cucumber water to drink. Frankly, I couldn't justify paying more for juice than I paid for my entrée. (Huge cheapo moment). 

I enjoyed my satay as it was a good amount of skewers and actually tasted like I had ordered them from a Thai restaurant. The wrap was okay... lacked a little flavor as I couldn't taste any sauce, but it wasn't bad. I liked the tofu fries I ordered along with it. 

One of the best parts was seeing all the pre/post workout LVAC members who entered and exited as we ate. This not only gave me more motivation to get my booty in the gym, but also showed that this business was thriving and providing great, healthy options for those in town. I love seeing a place with active "regulars." 

On my next visit, I hope not to be too cheap to not try the juices and smoothies. :)

So far, so good! Excellent service & excellent food. This was my second visit and had an acai bowl for the first time ever, that made me think....why have I never tried this before! It was so yummy! I had the breakfast burrito the last time and that was amazing also.

Vegan, gf & raw! So excited! 
THOSE WITH CELIAC'S/GLUTEN INTOLERANCE BE CAREFUL: see below

I was very excited to discover this chain had opened up on the southwest part of town. They are ingeniously located near LVAC, making it easy to get a healthy recovery meal after your workout. We ordered: Pumpkin spice chai latte, veggie garden burger, and bison burger. Total after tip= $38.10 (we took our food to go). A little on the high end $$$. Our food came out pretty quickly, but our smoothie took longer than expected. I was hoping to get that first and sip on that as an appetizer while we waited for our food. I don't know if they forgot about our smoothie or was just slow on making it. I did notice however, people after me get their drink before me, they also knew him on a first name basis and gave him the extra out of the blender in a separate cup. They should treat everyone as if they are a regular. Talk about not making me feel special. 

~Pumpkin Chai Tea Latte; Chai Tea, Pumpkin, Green Cabbage, Carrots, Butternut Squash, Flax Seeds, Ginger, Cinnamon, Nutmeg, Walnuts, Agave Nectar. This was really good and very filling. Although the cabbage was pronounced, the smoothie was well balanced and tasted raw (the way I like it).

~Bison burger w/ jicama fries; choice of swiss or cheddar cheese, lettuce tomato and onion on a whole grain bun. He wished he got it with cheddar rather than swiss. "Jicama fries" are just sliced jicama lightly seasoned with what looks/tastes paprika. 

*Veggie garden burger; I was extremely excited because I'm a sucker for alfalfa sprouts. I asked the cashier if the veggie patty was gluten free, as I have had a difficult time finding a veggie patty that does not use "wheat gluten" as a binder. He asked someone on the cooking line, who I assume was a manager, and he said "yes, it's gf, the patty is soy based protein" I took their word for it and gambled the risk. Sure enough I think the veggie patty is glutenous so BEWARE to those with celiac's/gluten intolerance. I got sick, as I do from eating or cross-contaminating with gluten/wheat. I have yet to bring my concern to the attention of the staff. Moving forward, the burger was eh-okay. My gluten free bun was hard (it's difficult to get a soft, buoyant bun using gluten free flour, especially if you're taking your item to go. In the future I will dine in. I ordered my burger with tofu fries. I was told that they dust the tofu blocks with rice flour and fry it in corn oil, so the oil should not be a point of cross contamination, as there isn't anything else with regular flour going into the oil. My burger came with the sprouts, bibb lettuce, tomato, and red onion. I also added vegan cheese, it's shredded.

We also added avocado to our sandwiches ($0.75/burger) for a quarter of an avocado (rip off). I don't mind paying extra for modifications, but make it worth my while and not be so skimpy! At least give me a half an avocado for that price, so that I can have it in every bite as opposed to just half my burger. I was charged extra for vegan cheese, again this would be fine, but there was less than a teaspoon sprinkled on my burger, with a $1.00 up-charge.

Although the food is pricey, it's raw, healthy, and typically quick, right up my alley. I will be back because there is not many others around like this and to inform them of my gf veggie patty concerns. There are just a few "tweeks" they need to adjust before they get the 5th star from me.I hope they properly label their menu on their website and physical menu so gluten free & vegan items are clearly marked. Just remember they do not operate out of a certified gluten free kitchen, but it seems that for the most part they handle issues like cross contamination okay.

Service was exceptional. There was a constant line (with one cashier) at 3:00pm. He was very nice and patient with me since I had a lot of questions.

We have been here twice now, and still not impressed.

The customer service and staff are excellent, which is why I gave them two stars.
However, I have not had anything there that I liked yet. I am a huge smoothie fan, but there's aren't up to par. Have had much better in this area of town.

Meh. I came here entry because I had to be somewhere super early and didn't have anything at home to make breakfast. I had briefly looked over their menu and was interested in trying a juice and the Acai bowl. Once I got there I realized that I was more hungry than I thought so I decided to order their breakfast burrito, the Acai bowl and the watermelon and strawberry juice smoothie. The total was like 18 bucks, damn! Anyway, the juice was fine. The burrito had no flavor whatsoever. They give you a little salsa on the side to spice it up, but even that was not sufficient. Eggs just need butter and salt, and this contained none of that. The acai bowl was good, and I have been back about three times to order it again. Others the that, it really is expensive and not as flavorful as I would have liked.

Not bad at all!! This healthy food chain is pretty fantastic. It is super clean, service is friendly, and the food is good. They have their calorie counts clearly listed, and tons of options! I was actually pretty overwhelmed by all of the choices. Most items average close to $10, so this isn't the cheapest lunch spot, but all things considered (including the refreshing-and free- cucumber water), I can't gripe about spending a few extra dollars.
Awesome concept. Very friendly and efficient staff. Very fresh, healthy and proportioned menu with lots of choices for all diets.

I am a healthy eater. Annoyingly healthier eater. Eating out has been know to be frustrating since my husband and I have different tastes and appetite sizes.  

Greens and Proteins is a perfect fit for our family. Good quality ingredients that appeal to both the herbivore and the carnivore and our son who is in the middle. 

My husband has the BBQ chicken pizza and loved it. Plenty of food to fill full without feeling stuffed. I have the veggie sandwich and cleaned my plate. 

Great service. Great food. Comfortable casual dinning experience. This will be a regular lunch spot for us.

Stopped by today for the first time . I had the Chocolate Veggiechino.  It was delicious. I love that they use all natural ingredients. I would suggest this Cafe to anyone looking for a healthy alternative.
We ate here on Sunday.  I had their salmon and my husband their veggie burger.   I got food poisonong from their fish and three days later, I'm still sick.  I'll never eat there again.

The best green smoothie I've ever had.  I will go back before I have to head home out of state. 

This place was clean & the service was great. I kept looking at the food items everyone else was having & they all looked delicious. 

I am very happy I found this place.

Not bad, food is pretty good, the drinks are different and definitely awesome to tryout. 

When I came I had a turkey burger with tofu fries, taste pretty good.

Im updating to 5 stars because they have added to the menu and in all the times I have been there (alot) they have not disappointed. Kudos here. And they just opened a new location at Rainbow & 215, which is great for me. 

I love this place, the food is great for healthy living. Quality is great and ppl are nice, the owner does his best for his customers. I am absolutely addicted to the wellness drink. The reason i didnt give it 5 stars is because its a lil pricey for what you get and i wish they had more variety on the menu and daily specials. Perhaps they could use an executive chef that puts a bit more flavor in the mix.

Overpriced and underwhelming, this clean and organized store is light and spacious, and the staff are really polite and friendly. I also love how they have quite a few local business cards and promo materials at the pickup counter where you get your drinks- shows that they are involved in the local community, which I really like to see.

That being said, their smoothies and wraps are each around $8, which sounds about on par with other similar businesses- and for the smoothies I would say it's about right.
But I was not impressed with my tofu/chorizo breakfast wrap- I asked for it in a spinach wrap, which I use frequently at home to make my own wraps, and this one was not particularly full. Most bites had more overlapping layers of tortilla than filling or veggies. On top of that, the menu lists the wrap as coming with "a side of tofu homefries"- this sounded really cool to me and I was excited to check it out.
Imagine my surprise when I open my take out box in my car and realize that a "side" consists of exactly THREE crouton-sized pieces of tofu. They were tasty, but considering I spent $8 on my meal and my take out box was half empty, I'm not pleased. I genuinely don't know if someone was in a hurry and forgot my side, or if three pieces really constitutes a portion- it doesn't to me.

I might come back, but it won't be for food- which is really disappointing, because everything sounds great.

Side note: If you check in on Yelp, you get a dollar off of a juice or smoothie, which helps a bit with the pricing.
This place has great vegan options for food and drinks. It's good quality, healthy, and tasty! It is pretty efficiently run as well, do they don't keep you waiting long even if it gets busy.

OMG wow! This place was so amazing! I'm not even the type of girl that enjoys eating healthy but this place actually was not that bad. I'm not even a big fan of Tofu yet I was munching on Tofu fries and let's not even get me started on how freaking bomb the barbecue pizza was... Like man oh man, I think I might need another Greens and Proteins fix again this week

I visited this place after a good workout becuase I could smell it from when I got out of the gym. Just as I was about to get irritated for the food taking too long to arrive, a nice gentleman brought me my cabbage wrapped burger. This was one of the best burgers I have ever had! The meat was seasoned perfectly and everything about it was delicious.

I realized that it takes time to prepare good quality delicious food. I will be going back, and I don't care how long my food takes, because it is well worth the wait. And what a friendly staff!!

My friend and I dropped into Greens and Proteins for a post-work out second breakfast of a "healthier" fare. 

The Southwest Tofu & Chorizo Burrito caught my eye; the idea sounded interesting, and so did its description: scrambled tofu and soy chorizo, tomatoes, cilantro, and Anaheim chilies, wrapped in a spinach tortilla. A side of tofu home fries originally comes with this, but you can replace that with another side listed on their menu. Also, you can choose to sub the tortilla with lettuce. With that being said, the burrito only looks good on paper. In this case, I would've preferred actual meat than the tofu because of the spices and ingredients. 

One cool thing to mention about this place is that the calories for each of the menu items -- excluding breakfast -- are listed. Prices for foods seem reasonable, much more reasonable than other "healthy" eateries by my gym. They do make smoothies and juices here, but I think $7.50 for a smoothie is too much, even with a Yelp check-in for $1.00 off.

Their food and smoothies are great to have after a good workout!! Their fruits/veggies are fresh not frozen!! :) I actually had to ask them to remake my smoothie because it was kind of runny - but the second one they remade for me was perfect!

I love that Greens and Proteins is a health-conscious restaurant that offers vegetarian/vegan options! . 

The food is amazing and the customer service is excellent! I love the G&P veggie burger, tofu fries, grilled vegetable wrap, hummus and pita, the build your own meal, (with tofu, edamame, sweet potato mash and aged balsamic reduction) acai bowl, granola crusted french toast, pancakes, and the banana bread, made with walnuts and chocolate chips! ANNOUNCEMENT: They are now serving sweet potato fries - yum! I LOVE that they do not fry any meat or fish, which prevents cross contamination for those who have dietary concerns. 

My meat-eating fiance likes the mini Ahi tostadas, Ahi protein salad, the California grilled chicken wrap and all of the above! He has yet to try a burger but they have only been open for a couple of weeks. We still have more to try!

I have been trying to eat healthier and be more aware of my portions, especially with the wedding around the corner. It is extremely helpful to have an idea of how many calories I am consuming per meal. However, I have let them know they should add the calorie count for the tofu fries - for consistency, of course. No joke, but I have been losing some weight after working out, along with eating a couple of meals here per week.

It is safe to say, I am a bit obsessed. Enjoy!

*New location in North Las Vegas. Please see my review.

I will say that they do what they do well. However, I'm not a health nut, so this review is from the perspective of a guy that has never stepped inside of a Whole Foods.

The atmosphere is bright and inviting. It just looks healthy. Almost like a Jamba Juice, but in restaurant form. The menus are clear and displayed nicely above the registers on a few flat screens.

I ordered the bison cheese steak on a wheat wrap. It comes with a side of tofu fries or jicama fries. I went with the tofu. The wrap wasn't bad. It tasted like a ground beef wrap. The tofu fries were surprisingly good. However, I'm a tofu fan, so take that with a grain of salt. My coworker on the other hand hates the tofu fries.  I wish there was an option to order something unhealthy here. Just because I want a healthy entree doesn't necessarily mean I want a healthy side too. I should be able to get artery clogging potato french fries with my healthy ostrich burger. I shouldn't be limited to an all or nothing healthy meal.

My coworkers love this place, so inevitably I'll be here again. I would never come here on my own though. I don't like paying a premium for anything, even if it is organic and healthy. On the bright side, the female eye candy was solid.

Strictly service. I love the food and drinks here! Very tastey and healthy! What I'm not happy with today is service. The counter girl, short tanned brunette has a really bad attitude about her. I felt like I was annoying her by ordering and that I was an inconvenience to her when I was asking her questions trying to figure out which shake I used to love to order. Wednesday morning 10:15 girl, work on your attitude.
It was good my sandwich was tasty and healthy. My wife's gluten free pizza with Low fat cheese was also tasty.
Glad to c another restaurant with some raw food options.  Would be nice if they had some fresh pressed green juices and some raw salad options.
Awesome selection but the ketchup has high fructose corn  syrup...for the price, I expect more.  Still would highly recommend trying this place out!

Amazing customer service! 

I did not ask the name of the lady at the register but she was very sweet and carried on a light conversation while taking my order, which I always appreciate! 

My antioxidant chiller tasted yummy and is one of my favorite things to get at Greens and Proteins! 

I always stop by here when I'm looking for a healthy snack and will definitely keep coming back!

I truly was not a fan of this place, the meals here were simple and unseasoned. I understand that their meals are healthier, but healthy does not mean flavorless.. They look and taste like something that cook at home, and let me tell you I'm not a great cook. I guess if you need gluten free items or if you are vegan this place offers an extended menu. However, you are also going to need to pay a bit more for it! 
I ordered the teriyaki chicken wrap with tofu fries and they were just so chewy! And let me just add that I love tofu, but they really dropped the ball on that one

Generally unimpressive--the food is healthy and service is quick. But flavors and portions are kind of weak. 

The Skinny Chef Salad is OK-it has a spicy mustard dressing. 

Definitely avoid the jicama fries. They are just cold, raw slices of jicama with seasoning. 

I would rather spend my money elsewhere.
A great place for healthy meals with a variety of options to choose from. I eat here a few times a week as I frequently order meals for pick up through chow now.

This is definitely one of my favorite health food places in Vegas! I'm really big in to health and fitness, and this place definitely meets the needs of health freaks, while also giving some more indulgent options as well. No matter what I always order the Wellness Drink every time I go. SO AMAZING and packed with fresh delicious ingredients. If you're a green juice person, this is the drink for you! I also usually always order their barbecue chicken pizza. The crust is amazing, the thin crust and the gluten free, I've had both, and the sauce and flavor is just incredible and the pizza only has 320 cals! How awesome. I have also had one of their wraps, forget the name but it's packed with a ton of vegetables and comes with tofu fries. So delicious, except I would say that the asparagus in the wrap was just a little too crunchy for me and kind of threw off the texture of the rest of it. I also have been to the Henderson location many times, and I must say this location just does it was better! The shape of their pizza is better and the taste of their smoothie was amazing.. but overall.. LOVEEE greens and proteins! definitely go if you have the chance! you won't regret it!!
Such a healthy place to eat. Your food is fresh they make it right after you order it. Great an environment.

Three stars means A-OK, and so far this is my experience with Greens & Proteins.   I do have yet to try any of the food, so when I do get around to doing that, I will update my review.  

I want to give it more stars, because I have really enjoyed both of the drinks I've purchased at this place.   

First time, I had the "Green Leaf Berry Blast".   A nice mix of berries and leafy greens.  It came out a sort of purplish-brown color but it really tasted great and filled me up.

The second time, I had the 'Wellness Drink', which is a mixture of green grapes, apples, limes, some other fruits and then a bunch of leafy greens.    The taste was fresh and fantastic, and it really hit the spot after my workout.    So yummy and it has all that good stuff in it.  

Customer service was fine both visits.   My drinks were ready in a snap.   The atmosphere of the place is inviting and comfortable and it works with their health-conscious atmosphere.   I could see myself eating here.

So why 3 stars?   I'm deducting one star because at 8 bucks a pop, well it seems a bit pricey for a cup of juice.  But that doesn't keep me away. 

The other star I am deducting for 2 reasons.   Lack of nutritional info and the use of agave nectar in every drink offering.   I track everything I take in, and I would think a place that serves up healthy food could offer more than a simple calorie count.  How much sugar is in these drinks?    Macros are important to my lifestyle.   I would like to see a more comprehensive breakdown.

And the agave is extra sweetener that is just unnecessary and really not a healthy choice IMO.

I am eager to try some of the food offerings.    I will update or offer up a better review at that time.
First time here great environment! Fresh fruit and healthy egg white omelette 13.22 with tip! Fast and friendly.

This is one of my favorites. I usually get the bbq chicken pizza on lavash. It tastes great and is low calorie. Service is always good despite having to wait in line sometimes (that means that it is good). My only complaint is that their wraps and burgers come with a choice of tofu fries or jicama fries as a side. I am not a fan of either and think sweet potato fries would be a great alternative.

Good Lookin' and Healthy is what you feel when you head in here for a snack! 
I enjoy this cause it's faster than me shopping for the ingredients and doing it myself when I'm in a crunch for time! 
Grab and go is how I feel when I stop for a smoothie and/or juice! 
Doc would be proud of me! 
Just wish they had more juices!           (((o(*ﾟﾟ*)o))) over all satisfied!!! I like the fact that it's yum stuff

Very healthy! They have all fresh organic breakfast and lunch items, hours mon-sun 7a-10p. A variety of raw juices. What I love about the menu is that you're able to customize your meal. i.e choose your protein, greens, grains and sauce. Have I mentioned it's healthy?!!! Yum
Of all the places in Las Vegas we chose this place because of its healthy flavorful food!  I love it!
Staff is friendly and accommodating to requests with orders but everything else is kind of blah

Probably not for everyone but if you're looking for a healthy meal then check this place out! Some of the meals are bland but at least you know you're eating real food with healthy organic ingredients. The drinks are good, some are hit or miss - I recently got the green heart drink and it was way too gingery!

I had brunch at this location for the first time last week, using a Groupon before it expired.  I was supposed to meet Suzy H. and her son here, but due to a miscommunication, she went to the Eastern location instead.  No problem.  Intending to share my food, it just meant that I ate two breakfast items all by myself, the Granola Crusted Whole Wheat French toast and the Greek Scramble.  Sure, I could have taken leftovers to go, but I just kept eating until there was nothing left but the parsley.  I guess I was hungry from my earlier swim, but it was also because the food was really good.  I'd been to the Eastern location about two years ago and had a so-so experience for dinner, so much so that I've never been back there.  This brunch, though, has changed my mind about G&P.  I would certainly come back anytime for a morning meal.  I had excellent service throughout, and, contrary to my own belief, the cost for breakfast wasn't as pricey as I thought it would be, $13.94 for both dishes.  Of course, having my Groupon handy made it even cheaper, but still.  I look forward to returning by myself, or with Suzy H., or with anyone else who wants to have a healthier breakfast at a decent price.   

P.S.:  Suzy H. and I ended up eating breakfast together after all, via cellphone.  That's what friends are for :)

Found them through Groupon. 

It's about 5 miles from the Strip but boy is it worth it!

My husband and I both ordered the southwest tofu and soyrizo burrito. Mind you my husband is a full on beefaterian, while I'm a vegetarian. It came with house salsa (amazing), and tofu house fries (bombtastic). The burrito had the right amount of heat but not too overwhelming. I also ordered a strawberry watermelon shake, it was so refreshing. They also offer complimentary cucumber lemon water, we couldn't get enough!

They offer a breakfast and lunch menu. They also have different types of proteins, such as bison and ostrich meat. Another reason to come here is their juices and shakes! 

A must try!

Vegan is hard to do. They did it!

Got the veggie burger with seasoned tofu fries. GF got the Cali Chicken wrap. Pumpkin spice tea and Chocolate veggieccino.
Best healthy kitchen spot in Vegas!!! The service is spectacular, and the food is incredible. I'm hooked!! I'm so happy my sister recommended this juice bar to me!! :-) :-) :-)

Not a juice bar. They do not serve juices. What they do serve is smoothies. All drinks are blended and contain fiber. That is not a juice. If you want fresh cold pressed juice I suggest you try one of the many other legitimate juice bars in the area.
One of my favorite places in Vegas. Great selection of healthy food choices for all three meals. Highly recommend this spot!

The green wellness drink was awesome. It took them a while to make it though which I didn't understand because people after me had already received their order. Must've been a mix up. Either way, still a yummy spot.

Decided to stop in here after finishing my leg workout at LVAC. I usually hit Tropical Smoothie but had been meaning to stop by this place. I needed something to go so I figured I would try one of the smoothies; they all seemed tempting. I settled on the Green Smoothie. I was pleasantly surprised when I took my first taste. I have to say I'll be back and next time try some of the food.

I go in here specifically for MANBAKE bars which are so so good! I love the double chocolate and cookie dough! They have a bunch of flavors right at the register when you walk in. Make sure you check the expiration date because they are all different ;)
I'm trying to eat & they are painting the restaurant during dining hours! Nothing like the fumes & scent of paint in a health food restaurant.
Great attitude of employees.  Great service.  FABULOUS greens drink.  Made the best way .. In a vitamix.  Great choice!!

I am currently a vegan and thought this place would be a great place to grab a healthy 'juice'. So I come here with my dad and he orders a parfait and I order a green 'juice' and the total comes to about $16 dollars with tip. I thought that was a tad on the expensive side but I know the prices of juice are very expensive because of the amount of vegetables and fruits that go into a juice (I worked at a juice bar for about two years so I understand juice pricing). So my 'juice' comes out and it's a smoothie? I do not know how they can call these smoothies juices?! It was frozen and it was really sweet for something that was considered a green juice. I was very disappointed and felt very mislead. My dad did not like his parfait either (too sugary). As a health nut and a biochemist I would not consider this place to be healthy at all. Albeit I have not tried any other items but i will assure you that I will not be coming back to try anything else. The only time that any one should go sugar load there is after a very High intensity work out. The only reason I have this place two stars is because the service was lovely. 

A note for the greens and proteins owners: 
I would recommend rewording the menu so it is not so misleading. I know you mean well and have a great idea but for people educated on health and wellness it is very misleading.

If I'm completely depleted after a workout and the thought of making a green smoothie or cooking breakfast makes me even more tired, you'll find me here picking up a Green Shake with Almond Milk. You can also see them cutting up fresh fruit and veggies in between orders. I have yet to venture out into their other drinks, but I did recently try their Breakfast Burrito that definitely fueled me post-workout. I know a lot of people say this place is over-priced, but healthy ingredients are generally pricier and what you are really paying for is the convenience and knowing/seeing your food is freshly prepared. And......they have packets of Cholula for to-go!

First experience and last. Most painful order experience. I asked what the restaurant was about. The girl couldn't and answer me just stared blankly. I asked her what the * meant next to lean angus burger and she had no idea what I was taking about. I should have turned and walked out and gone to the other protein place across the parking lot. I then asked about the Salads and then portion size. I made sizes with my hands. Again a blank stare. It was pulling teeth to get anything out of her. I will never go back again because of that experience. She was clueless, lazy, and did not want to work. I'm in sales and I work for my money. I expect others to as well.

Came here thinking they were going to offer ORGANIC food and drinks, but what a huge let down. They're selling you a product stating it's healthy, but really where is the health benefit from buying foods and drinks that contain gmos and chemicals?!?! When I asked if they had any organic produce, the gentleman stated "some of it" but couldn't tell me what was, therefore leading me to believe none of it is organic. Call me a food snob all you want, but if you're going to proclaim yourself as a healthy alternative then sell non-gmo, organic foods.

Very good first time dining at this place! The menu is kind of expensive but then again what can you expect from a place that aims for healthy eating! They have this $1 off coupon that you can use on the $7.50 smoothie drink :-/ it was ok.. I ordered the "Wellness" drink which I could've made at home myself nothing special..I feel like they should give more than a dollar off that's not even covering the tax on the drink itself but that's neither here nor there.. On to the food.. So my friend talked me into ordering the Bison Cheese Steak which honestly was good but for sure not worth $10.99 I got a pinch on cheese steak with ALL that bread and some light mozzarella.. I enjoyed the tofu fries more than anything else to be honest! I guess I'll just have to try something different on the menu because I won't let one mediocre experience take away from the whole dining experience..

When I wrote my initial review all I had had here were the smoothies and they were a little sweet for my taste. However, after trying the food this is like hella my new favorite place to eat. 

The service is awesome, the place is always clean, the food is IN. SANE. and really reasonably priced. Honestly this place rocks. Breakfast served all day and the caloric value of each item is stated on the menu. 

For realz, if you are looking for a delicious, healthy, and quick meal at any time of day I definitely recommend this joint.

Finally, a taste of heaven on the WEST-Sideeeee! ;) 

*The bison burger wrap is all that and then some. (Ask for 1/2 jicama and 1/2 tofu fries)

*The chef skinny salad is the perfect combination of greens and proteins, topped with an amazing dressing.

*Berry blast and wellness drinks are a meal in one, perfect for breakunch. (Breakfast-lunch combination) 

Keep up the consistent work, G&P's!
